Question: What is the difference in a size 8 and 8C?
Answer: The "Size 8" only represents the length of the shoe. Whether properly stated or not, every shoe/boot has, and should include a number/letter pair (e.g., "C" to "EEE") designating the length and width of the shoe respectively. "8 C" would represent a relatively narrow size 8.

Question: what does the c stand for in sizing?
Answer: "C" indicates the width of the shoe (i.e., "C", "D", "E", "EE", etc.). a shoe of "C" width would be relatively narrow.

Question: How does the TSA inspector unlock it without the combination?
Answer: They have a special key.

Question: How does the TSA inspector unlock it without the combination?
Answer: On the bottom of the lock, is a key hole for a "master key" that TSA has available!

Question: How does the TSA inspector unlock it without the combination?
Answer: They have a master key to unlock "TSA approved locks" per their website. If you use a lock that is not TSA approved, they will cut off your lock.

Question: How does the TSA inspector unlock it without the combination?
Answer: There is a key hole on the back side. TSA can access it with a key then lock back up after. Airline employees shouldn't have a copy of this key.

Question: How does the TSA inspector unlock it without the combination?

Question: Has anyone had problems with Suunto not honoring warranties for those who purchased the Suunto core from amazon.com?
Answer: Depends on who the seller is, not whether it was bought on Amazon or not. However if seller is non-authorized (anyone selling discounted is usually a non-authorized as Suunto does not allow their authorized dealers to discount) that is when Suunto won't honor the warranty claim as they only honor warranty claims for purchased made from an authorized dealer

Question: is thes coin 90 % silver
Answer: Yes it is 90% silver. All dollar, half-dollar, quarter, and dimes from 1964 and back are 90% silver. From 1965 through 1974 all dollar and half-dollar coins are 40% silver - even the 1976 bicentiniel dollar and half dollar are 40% silver. Then from 1983 only special ordered coins are 90% silver.

Question: is thes coin 90 % silver
Answer: Yes-The percentage of silver in US coins dropped to 40% after 1964

Question: Do these keep your feet & hands warm?
Answer: No, they will make them warm. These are the thin, non-wind proof base layer and must be used together with a insulating top layer (wool is the best). Moving and rubbing hands together will create warmth inside this base layer, the insulating top layer will keep the created warmth inside :-)

Question: Could you please explain how to set it up ( the time ) and how to read it?
Answer: SET TIME-(from the manual)- hold b(lower) button for 2 seconds, press a to change the hours, then press b to switch to minutes, use a to change, and so on. As for reading it, you count as you would binary- for the time, you add up all the red lit up numbers for the hour, and all the blue ones for the minute. With date, you hit a on the time, and then blue is the month and red is the day. It definitely takes awhile to get used to, but in a week or so you'll be able to add the time in your head even without the numbers.

Question: Could you please explain how to set it up ( the time ) and how to read it?
Answer: Its the same as any other type of watch. The number on the side are hours and the ones on the bottom are minutes, its basic math. Minutes go from 1-59. So when setting up lets say i want it to say 10:05. the 8 hour and the 2 hour will both be lit. and the 1 and the 4 on the minutes will be lit.

Question: Will this product work or damage Ugg Rohnan boots?  That style is not the typical Ugg sheepskin boots - but have waterproof full grain leather.
Answer: It will definitely work.  Since the Rohnan boot is full grain smooth leather, sno seal will work perfectly. Just note that sno seal will definitely darken the boots' color, unless it is black to begin with.  One downside of sno seal is that after application, the surface of the leather becomes slightly tacky/sticky, which attracts dust and dirt.  Other than that, sno seal really does waterproof boots and shoes.  Just make sure you work sno seal into any seams and stitch work. And make sure to heat the boots and/or the sno seal to melt the wax into the leather.

Question: After apply, blk smooth leather boot becomes slightly tacky/sticky that attracts dust/dirt how to prevent it?
Answer: use a hairdryer to melt the sno seal in. do not over heat

Question: After apply, blk smooth leather boot becomes slightly tacky/sticky that attracts dust/dirt how to prevent it?
Answer: warm the boots up...in sunny spot maybe? and re buff them. Too much wax makes em sticky. Heat and buff thins the coating.

Question: After apply, blk smooth leather boot becomes slightly tacky/sticky that attracts dust/dirt how to prevent it?
Answer: wipe dust off with a moist cloth.

Question: After apply, blk smooth leather boot becomes slightly tacky/sticky that attracts dust/dirt how to prevent it?
Answer: A little goes along way ,You have to get the leather real hot and it will soak up the sno seal. Let the boots set for a day or too in a warm room you should be good to go ,

Question: After apply, blk smooth leather boot becomes slightly tacky/sticky that attracts dust/dirt how to prevent it?
Answer: Need to buff out with shoe or soft brush.

Question: What if your boots already have salt stains?  Will this cover them up?
Answer: It should help not sure if it will cover them up totally but it should help.

Question: What if your boots already have salt stains?  Will this cover them up?
Answer: If your boots currently have salt stains embedded in leather. First you must thoroughly clean your boots with Saddle Soap boot cleaner. Make sure to also remove laces on boots to clean every area.  Let them dry overnight. Brush or wipe off all the Saddle Soap cleaner from boots. Then apply a thorough coating of Sno-Seal on boots. Use a hair dryer on warm setting to melt the Sno-Seal appl. on boots. Let boots sit overnight and brush or wipe off Sno-Seal next day. You may need to apply to applications of Sno-Seal on your boots to fully remove salt stains in leather. Good Luck.

Question: Lock Laces - can you lace them up as tight as you want?
Answer: Yes, and you bring up a good point about tight shoe laces.  Something as simple as keeping your laces tied up good might actually help prevent Achilles tendinitis! (if you do have it, suggest doing eccentric exercises like the kind in the book Treat Your Own Achilles Tendinitis). A 2010 study in the Clinical Journal of Sports Medicine showed that keeping your laces tied up did significantly reduce tension on your Achilles tendon - compared with untied laces.

Question: Lock Laces - can you lace them up as tight as you want?
Answer: Yes.  They have good adjustability.

Question: Lock Laces - can you lace them up as tight as you want?
Answer: Yes! You press down on the lock and get them as tight as you want by pulling the lace. Then release the lock. The lock can be a little hard to press down but it works great and stays in place.

Question: Can these be used for water shoes, including water aerobics shoes which are in chlorinated pool water?

Question: Can these be used for water shoes, including water aerobics shoes which are in chlorinated pool water?

Question: Can you use more than one lace per shoe? That is so they'd work for work boots?
Answer: But of course, it would require two locks also, but your answer is Yes!

Question: Do you think these would work for someone with the use of only one arm? Currently using velcro closures.
Answer: It takes two hands to set up the lock laces into place. Mainly slipping the laces into the lock wheel because it is not difficult but not easy to hold the button down, which opens the wheel, to allow the laces to thread into. After the set up process, fit the shoe how you want it to feel while wearing them and you will never need to tighten, loosen or use two hands to slip your shoes on again.

Question: Do you think these would work for someone with the use of only one arm? Currently using velcro closures.
Answer: It will be pretty hard. It's possible but not simple. You need to squeeze the retainer and pull the laces tight at the same time.

Question: Do you think these would work for someone with the use of only one arm? Currently using velcro closures.
Answer: If someone else initially laced the shoes and adjusted the tightness, then getting your foot in and out with one hand would work well.  These would be very difficult to tighten with one hand. But most days there is no need to tighten them.

Question: Can you use the locks on regular laces?
Answer: No there would be no reason to do that. The laces are elastic and allow you to slip shoe on and off with ease and keep the laces from coming undone while exercising.

Question: Can you use the locks on regular laces?
Answer: The 'locks' have nothing to do with the function of the laces except to keep the ends from fraying. Lock laces are used IN PLACE of regular laces. Remove and discard the regular laces, replace with lock laces, cut off any excess and clip the 'locks' on the ends. The lock laces are ELASTIC to allow putting them on and off without tying.

Question: Can you use the locks on regular laces?
Answer: you could, but without the stretchiness of the included lace material, not certain that would be an ideal solution. the locks have teeth designed for this material, but they would probably work on regular laces, too.

Question: what is the diameter of the cord?

Question: can this work with any hone system?
Answer: This is simply a metal alert badge on a chain.  It does not connect with any other device or system. Question: Does the red button on the watch have to be pressed in order to obtain a reading? Or is there a constant read out of the current heart rate?

Question: Is the smaller measurment on each of these duffel bags the circumference or width measurment?
Answer: Actually, neither one.  The dimensions of the bag (length and width) are the size of the bag when it is empty, laying flat on the floor. Question: How does this work?? No instructions at all. worthless
Answer: How to remove links from a watch band, EASY Watch ... - YouTube  Click on this YouTube site and it will show you how. It's not hard at all.

Question: How does this work?? No instructions at all. worthless
Answer: It is very easy, first, the pins only come out in one direction. If the watch band is not marked with an arrow (like the Invicta) see if you can a split in the middle of the end of pin, if so, push from the other  side. Keep every thing lined up straight and you should have no trouble pushing the pins out. To replace the pin, push the pin in solid end first , The split side expands to keep the pin in place.

Question: What is the purpose of buying with 5, 9, or 12 pins?  When you remove links, won't you end up with spare extra pins and links that you don't need?

Question: what is a collar extender?
Answer: The collar extender is a loop that connects the top button and buttonhole to give the wearer an additional half inch. It allows the wearer to continue wearing a shirt instead of buying a larger size. It's especially helpful if you don't want the additional fullness of a larger shirt but feel uncomfortable around the neckline.

Question: what is a collar extender?
Answer: A collar extender increases the neck size of collars fron 1/2 to one full size so if your neck size gets bigger you can keep existing shirts. One end fastens to the collar button hole and the other end attaches to the collar button.

Question: what does the medical alert DO? Does it beep or what?  Is it loud? What sets off an alert?
Answer: It does not beep, honk or shine. It is a dog tag that has a rubber ring around it and if involved in an accident or if you become incapacitated when medical personnel cut your clothing off they will see the medical alert ID tag and read what it says. This will let them know if you have allergies to drugs, are a diabetic of if you suffer from seizures for epilepcy or anything you put on your ID tag. Hope this helps.

Question: what does the medical alert DO? Does it beep or what?  Is it loud? What sets off an alert?
Answer: It lets someone know your medical condition if you are not able to tell someone. No sounds. It's printed information on a piece of metal.

Question: what does the medical alert DO? Does it beep or what?  Is it loud? What sets off an alert?
Answer: The "Medical Alert ID Dog Tag" is simply that, a tag with printed medical information that you hang around your neck. It does not sound anything.

Question: what does the medical alert DO? Does it beep or what?  Is it loud? What sets off an alert?
Answer: Just a medical dog tag w/my medical conditions ingraved on it.

Question: what does the medical alert DO? Does it beep or what?  Is it loud? What sets off an alert?
Answer: when medics see it it tells them (though the engraving) what medical conditions you have so they can treat you even if you can not tsll them your medical history. No lights no beepers.

Question: which one is better galaxy gear, galaxy gear 2 or galaxy gear neo?dont know much about them,i'm trying to purchase 1 but confuse.need  help. thanks
Answer: The Galaxy Gear is the original watch that came out last fall. It's base operation system is Android. The Gear 2 and Gear Neo are the newest models. Notice that that Gear 2 and Gear Neo don't have the "Galaxy" prefix. They run an operation system called Tizen. The main differences between the Gear 2 and Gear Neo is that the the Gear 2 has a built in 2MP camera and has a metal body. The Gear Neo has a plastic body and no camera. So if you want one with all the bells and whistles, the Gear 2 is the newest one with the most features.

Question: Can this be put on a car, specifically a Pontiac Grand Am?
Answer: Shouldn't be a problem, just make sure you secure the carrier well (use more straps that come attached to the carrier) and it helps to put some sort of anti-slip material between the carrier and the roof, especially since you probably don't have a roof rack. Amazon sells a mat designed for this purpose but you can use just about any anti-slip material. The material keeps the carrier from slipping and protects the paint on the car. The size of the carrier is not too large so it should fit without overhang on an Grand Am.

Question: If you turn it off completely than you turn it back on will it always be blue
Answer: There is a switch with three (3) positions at the bottom of the light saber: 1 - Off, 2 - 'auto transform', and 3 - 'normal'.  In the 'normal' mode, the on/off switch on the side turns the light saber on.  The first time it comes on the light is blue for Anakin.  Turning it off and then back on, the light is red for Darth Vader.  If you want it blue again, turn it off and back on.
